name: NGTS-10
scenarioDescription:
The NGTS-10 Exoplanetary System


Overview

NGTS-10 is a star with 0.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.7 times its radius. It is located 1059.03 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

NGTS-10 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the NGTS-10 system


NGTS-10 b

NGTS-10 b was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of NGTS-10 b is 687.516 times the mass of Earth. The radius of NGTS-10 b is 13.507 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NGTS-10 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system NGTS-10, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Paranal Observatory.
